WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
It would be good if it was possible to control the indentation style/level for the JS outputted by tsc.

It currently always indents with 4 spaces, but existing codebases may have other indentation styles (2 spaces is very common) that are enforced by linting tools. This makes it necessary to either change the indentation style across the whole codebase, to add an exception for TS-generated files, or to add a post-compile step which re-indents all files. Neither of these is a desirable solution.
WorkItem.Summary: Indentation option for JS outputted by compiler

Comments.Message: This is a good suggestion to keep in mind as we enhance the end to end project system story with existing JS builds/linters/etc.
